I have a riddle I've debated with myself on how to answer.
 
 How do you tell whether a cup is half full or half empty?
 
 Any ideas?

post_info.post_title: How do you answer the cup riddle?

Depends on what's been in it. If it was full of grits and you saw traces of grits from the lip down halfway it's half empty. If you only see a half a cup of grits with no traces from halfway up, it's half full.
 
 Have a party with this one...emoticon_xhoho

I have a riddle I've debated with myself on how to answer.
 
 How do you tell whether a cup is half full or half empty?
 
 Any ideas?

 
 
 It is neither half 'full' nor half 'empty'. Those are subjective observations.
 
 It is mearly 'HALF A CUP OF WATER'. Which, IMO, is an objective observation.
Surely the cup is both at the same time.
Depends on what you are considering full. It is completely full in the sense that there are still molecules in the air above the liquid.
It depends on weather you are an optimist or a pessimist.
Do I win a prize now?
